What Is Peter Reading?

Most of my reading is on the internet, but I do also like to read offline paper books. So I’ve decided to keep a list, starting from the beginning of July 2011, and documenting all the books that I’ve read, the book I’m currently reading, and all the books I plan to read.

Eventually, if I get around to it, I also plan to write blog posts reviewing all the books on this list that I’ve read. But that goal may be too lofty. I don’t read books very fast, and I review them even slower… Time will tell.

If you have any suggestions for books to read, feel free to recommend some in the comments section!

Also, [GOT] means that I personally own the book. [GETTING] means I am in the process of getting the book and have it taken care of. [LIB] means the book is available to me via my university library. [LIB-GOT] means that I have the book checked out from my university library. [NEED] means that I need to buy the book. (See all of these in my Amazon Wishlist if you’re looking for gift ideas for me!)

Last updated: 27 December 2013

Currently Reading

Engaging College Men: Discovering What Works and Why by Gar Kellom and Miles Groth

Intend to Read

~ Self-Improvement and Business ~

  1. Never Eat Alone: And Other Secrets to Success, One Relationship at a Time by Keith Ferrazzi and Tahl Raz [GOT]

  2. How to Win Friends & Influence People by Dale Carnegie [GOT]

  3. The Charisma Myth: How Anyone Can Master the Art and Science of Personal Magnetism by Olivia Fox Cabane [NEED]

  4. I Will Teach You To Be Rich by Ramit Sethi [GOT]

  5. Stumbling on Happiness by Daniel Gilbert [LIB]

  6. How to Fail at Almost Everything and Still Win Big: Kind of the Story of My Life by Scott Adams

  7. Eat That Frog!: 21 Great Ways to Stop Procrastinating and Get More Done in Less Time by Brian Tracy

  8. The Lean Startup: How Today’s Entrepreneurs Use Continuous Innovation to Create Radically Successful Businesses by Eric Ries [GOT]

  9. The Four Steps to the Epiphany by Steve Blank [GOT]

  10. The Start-up of You: Adapt to the Future, Invest in Yourself, and Transform Your Career by Reid Hoffman and Ben Casnocha [GOT*]

  11. The Starfish and the Spider by Ori Brafman and Rod A. Beckstrom [NEED]

  12. Good to Great: Why Some Companies Make the Leap… and Others Don’t by Jim Collins [GOT]

  13. The Personal MBA: Master the Art of Business by Josh Kaufman [GOT]

  14. 18 Minutes: Find Your Focus, Master Distraction, and Get the Right Things Done by Peter Bregman

  15. The Checklist Manifesto: How to Get Things Right by Atul Gawande [LIB]

  16. Decisive: How to Make Better Choices in Life and Work by Chip and Dan Heath [GOT]

  17. A Whack on the Side of the Head: How You Can Be More Creative by Roger von Oech [GOT]

  18. The Copywriter’s Handbook, Third Edition: A Step-By-Step Guide To Writing Copy That Sells by Robert W. Bly [NEED]

  19. Producing Open Source Software: How to Run a Successful Free Software Project by Karl Fogel [GOT]

  20. Cracking the Coding Interview: 150 Programming Questions and Solutions by Gayle Laakmann McDowell [GOT]

  21. Programming Interviews Exposed: Secrets to Landing Your Next Job, 2nd Edition by John Mongan, Noah Suojanen, and Eric Giguère [GOT]

~ Cognitive and Decision Science ~

  1. Thinking, Fast and Slow by Daniel Kahneman [GOT]

  2. Thinking and Deciding by Jonathon Baron [GOT]

  3. How the Mind Works by Steven Pinker [GOT]

  4. An Introduction to Decision Theory by Martin Peterson [LIB]

  5. Rational Choice in an Uncertain World: The Psychology of Judgment and Decision Making by Reid Hastie and Robyn M. Dawes [LIB]

  6. Judgment in Managerial Decision Making by Max H. Bazerman and Don A. Moore [NEED]

  7. How We Decide by Jonah Lehrer [GOT]

  8. Kluge: The Haphazard Construction of the Human Mind by Gary Marcus [GOT]

  9. Mistakes Were Made (But Not by Me): Why We Justify Foolish Beliefs, Bad Decisions, and Hurtful Acts by Carol Tavris and Elliot Aronson [GOT]

  10. Why Everyone (Else) is a Hypocrite: Evolution and the Modular Mind by Robert Kurzban [LIB]

  11. Predictably Irrational, Revised and Expanded Edition: The Hidden Forces That Shape Our Decisions by Dan Ariely [GOT]

  12. The Upside of Irrationality: The Unexpected Benefits of Defying Logic at Work and at Home by Dan Ariely [GOT]

~ Persuasion Science ~

  1. Change of Heart: What Psychology Can Teach Us About Spreading Social Change by Nick Cooney [GOT]

  2. Influence: Science and Practice (4th Edition) by Robert B. Cialdini [GOT]

  3. Made to Stick: Why Some Ideas Survive and Others Die by Chip Heath and Dan Heath [GOT]

  4. Principles of Marketing (13th Edition) by Philip Kotler and Gary Armstrong [GOT]

~ Meta-Ethics ~

  1. Reasons and Persons by Derek Parfit [LIB]

~ Community / Society / Practical Ethics ~

  1. Veganomics: The Surprising Science on What Motivates Vegetarians, from the Breakfast Table to the Bedroom by Nick Cooney

  2. Compassion, by the Pound: The Economics of Farm Animal Welfare by F. Bailey Norwood and Jayson L. Lusk [GOT]

  3. The Animal Activist’s Handbook: Maximizing Our Positive Impact in Today’s World by Matt Ball and Bruce Friedrich [NEED]

  4. The Ethics of What We Eat: Why Our Food Choices Matter by Peter Singer and Jim Mason [GOT]

  5. Ethics Into Action: Henry Spira and the Animal Rights Movement by Peter Singer [LIB]

  6. Nudge: Improving Decisions About Health, Wealth, and Happiness by Richard H. Thaler and Cass R. Sunstein [GOT]

  7. What Money Can’t Buy: The Moral Limits of Markets by Michael J. Sandel [GOT]

  8. The Price of Inequality: How Today’s Divided Society Endangers Our Future by Joseph E. Stiglitz [GOT]

  9. How Much is Enough?: Money and the Good Life by Robert Skidelsky and Edward Skidelsky [GOT]

  10. Bowling Alone: The Collapse and Revival of American Community by Robert D. Putnam [LIB]

  11. World Poverty and Human Rights: Cosmopolitan Responsibilities and Reforms by Thomas W. Pogge [LIB]

  12. The Better Angels of Our Nature: Why Violence Has Declined by Steven Pinker [LIB]

  13. Beyond Fear: Thinking Sensibly About Security in an Uncertain World by Bruce Schneier [LIB]

  14. No Contest: The Case Against Competition by Alfie Kohn [LIB]

  15. Lying by Sam Harris [GOT]

~ Moral Science ~

  1. Moral Tribes: Emotion, Reason, and the Gap Between Us and Them by Joshua Greene

  2. Moral Psychology: The Evolution of Morality by Walter Sinnott-Armstrong [LIB]

  3. Moral Psychology: The Cognitive Science of Morality by Walter Sinnott-Armstrong [LIB]

  4. Moral Psychology: The The Neuroscience of Morality by Walter Sinnott-Armstrong [LIB]

  5. Evil: Inside Human Violence and Cruelty by Roy F. Baumeister and Aaron Beck [NEED]

  6. Neuroscience of Preference and Choice: Cognitive and Neural Mechanisms by Raymond J. Dolan and Tali Sharot [LIB]

  7. The Oxford Handbook of Human Motivation by Richard M. Ryan [NEED]

  8. Three Faces of Desire by Timothy Schroeder [GOT]

  9. How Pleasure Works: The New Science of Why We Like What We Like by Paul Bloom [LIB]

  10. The Science of Giving: Experimental Approaches to the Study of Charity by Daniel M. Oppenheimer and Christopher Y. Olivola [NEED]

  11. Altruism in Humans by C. Daniel Batson [LIB]

  12. The Moral Brain: Essays on the Evolutionary and Neuroscientific Aspects of Morality by Jan Verplaetse, Jelle de Schrijver, Sven Vanneste, and Johan Braeckman [LIB]

  13. Moral Minds: The Nature of Right and Wrong by Marc Hauser [GOT]

  14. Braintrust: What Neuroscience Tells Us about Morality by Patricia S. Churchland [LIB]

  15. The Origins of Virtue: Human Instincts and the Evolution of Cooperation by Matt Ridley [LIB]

  16. The Righteous Mind: Why Good People Are Divided by Politics and Religion by Jonathan Haidt [LIB]

  17. The Republican Brain: The Science of Why They Deny Science and Reality by Chris Mooney [GOT]

  18. Wild Justice: The Moral Lives of Animals by Marc Bekoff and Jessica Pierce [LIB]

  19. When Elephants Weep: The Emotional Lives of Animals by Jeffrey Moussaieff Masson and Susan McCarthy [LIB]

~ Politics and Economics ~

  1. Rick Perry and His Eggheads: Inside the Brainiest Political Operation in America, A Sneak Preview from The Victory Lab by Sasha Issenberg [NEED]

  2. Game Change: Obama and the Clintons, McCain and Palin, and the Race of a Lifetime by John Heilemann and Mark Halperin [GOT]

  3. A Darwinian Left: Politics, Evolution, and Cooperation by Peter Singer [LIB]

  4. The Machinery of Freedom: Guide to a Radical Capitalism by David Friedman [GOT]

  5. The Rhetoric of Economics by Deirdre N. McCloskey [LIB]

  6. Capitalism and Freedom by Milton Friedman [GOT]

  7. The Worldly Philosophers: The Lives, Times And Ideas Of The Great Economic Thinkers by Robert L. Heilbroner [LIB]

  8. Peddling Prosperity by Paul Krugman [LIB]

  9. The Conscience of a Liberal by Paul Krugman [LIB]

  10. Armchair Economist: Economics & Everyday Life by Steven E. Landsburg [LIB]

  11. Eat the Rich: A Treatise on Economics by P. J. O’Rourke [LIB]

  12. A Random Walk Down Wall Street: The Time-Tested Strategy for Successful Investing by Burton G. Malkiel [LIB]

  13. Reinventing the Bazaar: A Natural History of Markets by John McMillan [LIB]

  14. Law’s Empire by Ronald Dworkin [LIB]

  15. The Conservative Assault on the Constitution by Erwin Chemerinsky [LIB]

~ Bayes Theorem, Probability, and Philosophy of Science ~

  1. The Structure of Scientific Revolutions by Thomas S. Kuhn [GOT]

  2. Proving History: Bayes’s Theorem and the Quest for the Historical Jesus by Richard Carrier [GOT]

  3. Epistemology and the Psychology of Human Judgment by Michael A. Bishop and J. D. Trout [LIB]

  4. Probability Theory: The Logic of Science by E. T. Jaynes [GOT]

  5. Causality: Models, Reasoning and Inference by Judea Pearl [LIB]

~ Foreign Aid & Development Economics ~

  1. Dead Aid: Why Aid Is Not Working and How There Is a Better Way for Africa by Dambisa Moyo [LIB]

  2. Poor Economics: A Radical Rethinking of the Way to Fight Global Poverty by Abhijit Banerjee and Esther Duflo [LIB]

~ Religion: Theology & Sociology ~

  1. Aquinas: Beginner’s Guide by Edward Feser [NEED]

  2. The Last Superstition: A Refutation of the New Atheism by Edward Feser [NEED]

  3. American Grace: How Religion Divides and Unites Us by Robert D. Putnam and David E Campbell [GOT*]

  4. Dynamics of Faith by Paul Tillich [LIB]

~ Uncategorized ~

  1. Gödel, Escher, Bach: An Eternal Golden Braid by Douglas R. Hofstadter [GOT]

  2. Surely You’re Joking, Mr. Feynman by Richard P. Feynman, et al. [LIB]
